intro: Amphilophium campinae, commonly known as the Cape fynbos lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in the fynbos biome. It produces showy white or pale pink blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
